basics.name: Benjamin Hyokeun Oh
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: I work in the blockchain space, mainly on Ethereum development, and I am building my career plan by leveraging my security background and development experience.

work.name: Emohtrams, Best of the Best 6th, KITRI
work.summary: Emohtrams, a Best of the Best 6th project at KITRI, aimed to discover vulnerabilities in smart home network IoT devices and build a multi-diagnosis program. I served as the Project Leader and mentored the team. The team found vulnerabilities that allowed control over connected IoT devices after gaining router privileges, and we disclosed the findings to multiple media outlets.
highlights: Smart Home Hacking in Real World (Codegate 2017) - http://codegate.org/assets/kr/files/Smart%20Home%20Hacking%20in%20Real%20World.pdf

[Urgent] Critical vulnerabilities in apartment smart homes expose hundreds of thousands of residents; remote control of car gates, lobby doors, and front door locks - http://www.dailysecu.com/?mod=news&act=articleView&idxno=26932
Smart home security found to be full of holes - http://news.jtbc.joins.com/article/article.aspx?news_id=NB11562517

work.name: doobit
work.summary: Worked as a full-stack developer. Built iOS/Android apps to control a hand-sterilization wearable device, a CMS for hospital management systems, and handled beacons/Bluetooth communications. Also covered various frontend tasks as needed.
highlights: Wearable Sterilizer - MWC Barcelona 4YFN Best5 2017 - https://bdci.co.kr/wearable-sterilizer
Startup doobit introduces a wearable device that shows hand hygiene status - https://news.joins.com/article/22225496
Five of the most curious gadgets at Mobile World Congress - https://www.levante-emv.com/vida-y-estilo/tecnologia/2017/03/03/5-gadgets-curiosos-mobile-world-12252715.html
Hands-on coverage of 4YFN featuring unique startup products like a card-type phone and smartphone-linked items - https://k-tai.watch.impress.co.jp/docs/event/mwc2017/1047428.html
[Tomorrow's Star! 2017] Prevent infectious diseases with a wearable device 'Gredo' - https://www.etnews.com/20170519000194
doobit, Insu Jang, interview at 4YFN 2017 (ENG & KOR) - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QZVcPlmrrvU

work.name: Guardians of IoT@Home, Best of the Best 4th, KITRI
work.summary: Guardians of IoT@Home, a Best of the Best 4th project at KITRI, aimed to discover vulnerabilities in home IoT devices and create response guidelines. I dumped firmware and performed static analysis at the source-code level as well as dynamic analysis using various tools. I investigated Z-Wave and Zigbee-based home hubs and smart wallpads for home automation, found vulnerabilities that allowed control over connected IoT devices after gaining router privileges, and presented the findings at multiple conferences.
highlights: 4th Lemon Information Security Seminar announcement - http://blog.securityplus.or.kr/2015/10/4.html

2015 CodeEngn Conference 12, Guardians of IoT@Home [Jung Hyojeong] - https://github.com/codeengn/codeengn-conference/blob/master/12/2015%20CodeEngn%20Conference%2012%2C%20Guardians%20of%20IoT%40Home%20%5B%EC%A0%95%ED%9A%A8%EC%A0%95%5D.pdf

volunteer.summary: Conducted regular on-campus server security audits and penetration testing. Wrote reports on data leaks discovered through basic web hacking and network attack techniques.

projects.name: Core Vault Finance Bounty
highlights: Reported a math error inside the LGE ending function. This would result in the LGE not being able to end until it is fixed.
Reported a second math error inside the LGE ending function. This would result in the LGE not being able to end until it is fixed.
Reported possible attack on running average after LGE & adding liquidity at a too high/low of a price.
